creator: marten.bohlin@drutt.com
text:
In batik 1.5.1 there seems to be a probem if an gif-image is base64 encoded in
an image tag. If the same image is inserted as jpg it works fine.

Example tag:
  <image width="132" height="176" id="XMLID_1_"
xlink:href="data:;base64,R0lGODdhhAC.............."/>

Instead of my image I get a image with the text "Broken Image".

An example can be found at http://public.benareby.com/gif.svg

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
The SVG standard doesn't require support of GIF.
I suggest you replace your GIF images with PNG images (many free tools
are available to transcode them).

If this is really a problem for you I would suggest producing a patch,
but I think the issue is the way the JDK let's you decode images.
